meanings.sent1: Stop trying to hassel your little sister while she's studying.
meanings.sent2: The loud music from the party next door continued to hassel the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy would always find a way to hassel the cat.
meanings.sent4: The persistent rain would hassel the farmers trying to harvest their crops.
meanings.sent5: The buzzing mosquito would hassel me all night long.

meanings.definition: A situation that causes difficulty or trouble.
meanings.sent1: Moving to a new city can be a real hassel with all the packing and unpacking.
meanings.sent2: Dealing with a broken car can turn into a major hassel if you rely on it for work.
meanings.sent3: The lost keys turned into a comical hassel as the whole family searched for them.
meanings.sent4: The traffic jam on the highway was a huge hassel for commuters trying to get home.
meanings.sent5: Trying to fix the leaky faucet turned into a bigger hassel than expected.
